snippet: Weighing just 80 milligrams, the tiny robot, whose wings can be controlled separately, can mimic a fly’s aerial maneuvers.
abstract: Journal Science reports that scientists have developed remote-controlled robot the size of housefly that mimics fly's aerial prowess; robot, part of larger project at Harvard University to create robotic bugs, could help researchers study evolution of insects.
lead_paragraph: Weighing just 80 milligrams, the tiny robot, whose wings can be controlled separately, can mimic a fly’s aerial maneuvers.
